properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke plumes are moving over Western and Southern Quebec because of several fires over Northwestern Ontario. Air quality conditions could deteriorate if the smoke spread at ground level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T14:32:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-09T22:33:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3376160805.2019

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert: Overland Flow Flood Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Update 2 – The flooding in Yellowhead County can impact local residents by possibly contaminating water wells and sewer systems, and residents should contact the county to report these issues. The areas of Niton Junction, Carrot Creek, and low-lying areas along the Lobstick River to the east, and the Chip Lake area as water flows towards the Pembina River currently have flooding in their area.### Following the impact of floodwater on local residences, water well contamination and sewage issues are possible. Residents are encouraged to contact the Emergency Operations Centre hotline at 1-833-334-4630 to report any such issues and to have their water supplies tested for contamination. Dangerous driving conditions are reported on: - Township Rd. 532 west of Range Rd. 125 - Old Carrot Creek Highway between Range Rd. 140 and Range Rd. 141 - Range Rd. 135 North of Township Rd. 540 - no vehicle exit for residents - Niton North Road south of Township Rd. 542 - Niton North Road south of the railway crossing - Township Rd. 542 west of Niton North Road - no vehicle exit for residents - Range Rd. 135 south of Township Rd. 534 More available at https://www.facebook.com/yellowheadcounty/ Facebook page.
Expires: 2019-07-16T17:06:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County, 2019-07-09T17:04:34-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5912
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution due to smoke from forest fires will continue tonight for a large part of Northern Ontario. Smoke plumes are moving over the region from several forest fires located in the Sandy Lake - Pikangikum region. There are also additional smaller fires in Northeastern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. If you or someone in your care develops symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoor activities until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T20:35:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-07-10T04:36:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2465370146.2019
Area: Attawapiskat, Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Webequie, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki, Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul, Armstrong - Auden - Wabakimi Park, Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, Fort Albany, Moosonee, Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hot and humid conditions are expected today. Daytime high temperatures will be near thirty degrees with humidex values in the mid thirties. A low pressure system is expected to move through the area on Thursday bringing cooler temperatures with it. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T01:04:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:05:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0398558257.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulates are expected and will result in poor air quality. Smoke plumes are moving into Southwestern Quebec from several wildfires in Northwestern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate at ground level. High levels of pollutants are expected to persist until Wednesday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-10T17:59:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2019-07-09T21:13:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1819304279.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Heavy rain will continue this evening in southwest Manitoba. As of 4 pm several stations in this area have reported rainfall totals in excess of 30 mm, and further rain is expected this evening with total amounts around 50 mm in many areas by Wednesday morning. The heaviest rain should occur this evening, with rain tapering off from west to east towards morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T13:54:56-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain across much of southern Manitoba will continue through the remainder of the night. However, it is beginning to weaken in southwestern areas. The rain will continue to weaken or end from west to east and should be out of the province by mid morning. There has been a great variability of rainfall totals across southern Manitoba since the rain began Tuesday. There have been numerous reports of rainfall amounts over 50 mm in a broad swath from Winnipeg to Melita. Further rainfall amounts will be a few millimeters in southwestern areas to up to 10 in southeastern areas. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T17:39:43-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FOR YUKON The office of the Yukon Chief Medical Officer of Health has issued an Air Quality Advisory for all Yukon communities due to high or increasing concentrations of wildfire smoke. Wildfires in Alaska and central Yukon are causing increased concentrations of smoke throughout the territory. Local conditions may also affect the concentration of smoke in each community. Please note that there is no immediate wildfire threat to any Yukon communities. Smoke can impact your health if it lingers in your community. Please observe the following recommendations: - You may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, eye or throat irritation, or shortness of breath. If you are experiencing symptoms, limit outdoor activity and/or strenuous physical activity; if breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce the activity. - Make sure you identify and support those who are at increased risk from wildfire smoke. These include small children, elders, pregnant women, and those with lung or heart disease. - If you have a health condition that could worsen with the smoke (asthma, chronic lung disease or COPD, or heart disease) check in with your health care provider to make sure that you have a plan for managing your condition. Make sure your medications and supplies are available and up-to-date. - Reduce exposure to smoky air by staying indoors and turning on an air cleaner with a HEPA filter, if you have one. Keep indoor air as clean as possible by avoiding smoking or burning other materials. - If your symptoms worsen or you are concerned about your health or the health of a friend/family member, contact the health line at 811, contact your health care provider, or go to your Community Health Centre or hospital emergency department. - For advice about keeping your home air clean and cool visit www.hss.gov.yk.ca/wildfiresmoke.php - To view an hourly forecast of smoke conditions in Yukon, visit www.firesmoke.ca/forecasts/current ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-11T03:48:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon, 2019-07-10T11:49:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2424092583.2019
Area: Dawson, Mayo, Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks, Kluane Lake, Haines Junction, Whitehorse, Teslin Y.T., Cassiar Mountains Y.T., Watson Lake Y.T., Faro - Ross River, Dempster, Old Crow
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Government of Yukon

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy rainfall possible today. Rain and isolated thunderstorms are expected tonight as a low pressure system moves across Northwestern Ontario today. Rainfall amounts are forecast to be highly variable across the region, with a few areas receiving 20 to 40 mm, and local 50 mm possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm. The rain will move out of the area this evening low pressure system moves away to James Bay. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T17:23:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:24:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1255900057.2019
Area: Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain continues today. A large area of rain continues to soak the region today. Total rainfall amounts from this event of 50 to 75 mm are expected in many areas. A few locally higher rainfall amounts of 75 to 100 mm are possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm or two. Rain is expected to move out of the region this evening in the wake of a low pressure system moving from Northwestern Ontario to James Bay by this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T01:20:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:21:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1452255186.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Webequie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid air mass is returning to Southwestern Ontario for today and Thursday. Temperatures will peak in the low thirties this afternoon, with afternoon humidex values in the upper thirties. Minimum temperatures tonight will be in the low twenties, providing little relief from the heat. Temperatures on Thursday afternoon will reach the low thirties. A slightly cooler and less humid air mass will arrive in the wake of a weak cold front Thursday evening providing relief from the heat into Friday. However, hot and humid conditions may return once again on the weekend or early next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-10T23:42:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T07:43:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3827658526.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain continues today. A large area of rain continues to soak the region today. Total rainfall amounts from this event of 50 to 75 mm are expected in many areas. A few locally higher rainfall amounts of 75 to 100 mm are possible in areas that receive a thunderstorm or two. Rain is expected to move out of the region this evening in the wake of a low pressure system moving from Northwestern Ontario to James Bay by this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T01:20:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-10T09:21:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4126917560.2019
